alert.note: Alert for Grand (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 16 at 4:51PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Utah, within Grand County. * WHEN...Until 845 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos are possible, which could result in dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 446 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen upstream of Arches National Park. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Arches National Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
